Forum Post: 
Post title: automatic evaluation key for multiplechoice
Post description: Hello! I want to do a digital multiplechoice-test with moodle. For each question there are given 6 answers. More then 1 answer can be correct. I want to score the number of correct students-answers by 4 points <-- all 6 answers are declared correctly (as wrong or as right) 2 points <-- only 5 answers are declared correctly 1 point <-- only 4 answers are declared correctly 0 points <-- 3 or more answers are not declared correctly Does anybody know how to do this (automatically) with moodle?

Forum Post: 
Post title: Add a short response item to Choice activity?
Post description: I am using the Choice activity to have students sign up for in-class presentations over the course of several days. I can use the Choice function to let them sign up for times and limit how many can sign up for a single day so we spread people out. However, I'd like to have an option for them to then answer a short response with the topic of their presentation so I (and the class) can see what topics will be presented each day. Is there any way to add a second question to the Choice activity, or include a "comment" on the choice selected where students could input their topic? Alternatively, are there any question types available in the Feedback or Quiz modules that would accomplish the same function as the Choice? I could build the short answer question into a Feedback activity, but I couldn't find any option for a "signup" type question where the number of responses to each choice is limited. I could, of course, use two different modules for the two different questions, but that is awkward and likely to get poor response from students.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Extended 'CHOICE' activity
Post description: I'm looking for an extended 'CHOICE' activity that does the following: Students need to make choices for several activities . Every activity is a certain amount of hours (between 3 and 7). Students must register for a minimum of 14 hours activities, but a maximum of 25 hours of activities. We need to make sure a student doesn't register for to little or to much hours. Also: we want limitations on the number of students per activity. At least 5 students should register for an activity for it to even start. A maximum of 20 students per activity can be registered. The choice module does have a maximum, but not a minimum registrations. Are there custom plugins out there to set something like this up?

Forum Post: 
Post title: Restrictions based on Choice - again
Post description: Hello everyone! Trying to implement a guided route
on the educational material for my students using restricted access, I
realized that something is missing from Moodle. There is no way to
restrict access based on a choice activity. (*see note below) The restrictions that can be imposed on content are based on the following factors: activity completion date grades group grouping profile I strongly believe that adding the extra factor of "choice" on
the restrictions would help greatly and I believe that it shouldn't be
technically difficult to do so. What do you think? This feature has been mentioned multiple times in earlier discussions: https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=226273 (I agree with Mary and I have used this method, but this is different) https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=221923 https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=335529 Thanks in advance! (*) Note: There is a complicated way to do something similar, but not exactly this. By using the group choice plugin and the restriction
by group, we can partially achieve this, but it requires an extra
plugin and makes the restriction global for the whole course, not just
for the part that is needed. Added to this, in case where groups are
needed for other use, this workaround is not suitable.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Change default permission: Record a Choice
Post description: We use the choice activity for nearly every class session in a college course: Are you going to be in-person or virtual for this session? The default permission for this includes teachers as well as students. When the teacher then goes to view the results of the activity, all enrollees are shown (including teachers). Removing the role of the teacher from Record a choice on permissions fixes this. However, this must be done for each choice activity. The permission DOES NOT copy over when the activity is duplicated, making this process extremely tedious. Is there a way to change the default setting for this? Another workaround?

Forum Post: 
Post title: Add choice to a Course with guest 'enrolment'
Post description: Hi all, Moodle 3.5 I'd like to have the choice activity setup on a guest access Course page for our logged in users. Despite checking and testing the permissions for authenticated users etc. I still wasn't able to submit a choice without enrolment. We use choices almost like sign-ups, presenting time slots of availability. Some of our central workshops would like to use the Choice activity to allow students to book into their resources, without the need to be enrolled into their 'pages' (courses) - Wouldn't want student  dashboards to be full of 'upcoming' events. Appreciate that the end date could be removed, but it is useful. From a few historic posts, it suggests that Choice activities cannot be complete by unenrolled users by design, post Moodle 2.0 - Can anyone shed any light? If there are any alternatives in the standard Moodle activities that you can recommend instead, I'm more than happy to take a look. Many thanks as always, Anthony

Post description: Hi I use the Choice tool a lot in my courses, and my students get repeated errors.  In a class of about 60 students, at least a third will get an error message when trying to select a choice.  They select again, and some of them can try up 5 or 6 times before their choice is selected.  In Ver 1.X this choice tool was fine, but since 2.X has had then problem.  It's unlikely to be browser-related, as it occurs in Firefox , Chrome and IE . If anyone has any guidance on this, please let me know. Thanks Regards Ken

Forum Post: 
Post title: Displaying results from a choice activity ONLY students and not guests
Post description: In the choice activity, if you change the setting "Publish Results" to "Always Show results to students" then the results are visible to everyone, students, guests, Google etc (Anything that can view the choice activity).  There doesn't actually seem to be a way to restrict the results to a group of users.  This has been reported in the tracker as MDL-50292 . I've proposed a patch on that issue ( MDL-50292 ) that would add a " mod/choice:viewpublishedresults" permission to the choice activity to allow us to control which users are actually allowed to see the results. I'm hoping to get some feedback from other moodlers on whether this is a good idea. Thanks!

Forum Post: 
Post title: Completion tracking on specific choice selected
Post description: In MDL-27680 ( https://tracker.moodle.org/browse/MDL-27680 ) was discussed "it might make sense to allow completion tracking to check which option is selected." This would enable choice module to be used as a "gatekeeper" where a user could not progress until they had selected the "continue" option. Currently, completion tracking does not distinguish between choices made. Such a change outlined above would also potentially require ability for a user to change their selection from "stop" to "continue" option. Dan, do you think such a change is practical in the wider Choice module, or should we look at a local customisation? Can you estimate the amount of work required to make such changes? Others here, do you have an alternative method (preferably that's not using the quiz module, since it's rather a clunky solution to the problem) for acting as a "gatekeeper" on a user's progress in the course?

New responses can be made, and the new ones are displayed correctly. Any idea, why I lost responses during backup/restore in the same moodle version? In addition to that, the order of choice options is mixed up after backup/restore. Best regards, Marcus

Post description: I am trying to create an ESL grammar assessment test using multiple choice. I want to automate this completely, so I want to associate each question and option with an area of grammar so that when the students' responses are tabulated in the database , that I can then generate reports from. Forum Post: 
Post title: Choice module: Feature proposal  add multiple choices.
Post description: Hello

I have seen that this topic has been asked at least a year ago and the standard answer
was that the feedback and questionnaire module would provide this functionality at least roughly.

I have tested feedback so far and it does not provide what I would need, since it does not publish the results of each student right away:

Rationale:

Periodically I submit a set of exercise to my students which they have to solve, and they can pick up the exercise they want to work with.

In order to avoid that some students pick up the same exercise I set up a choice activity:
Each question has limit 1, the results of the choice is published immediately with full names.
This way the student knows which exercise is already taken.

However when I do this, a student *cannot* pick up more than one exercise.
Frankly I think this restriction should be configurable in the sense that it should be allowed for a student to chose more than just one exercise.

In the feedback module there is no publication function, so the student cannot know which exercise is already taken.

what I have done so far is to have a choice activity for each exercise of a certain topic a procedure which is rather cumbersome.

That is why I would like to ask the authors of that module to add this option.

thank you

Uwe Brauer

Forum Post: 
Post title: Weekend Activity Registration
Post description: I teach at Linden Hall School, a private girls' boarding school with around 120 students.  We are looking for a better way to allow students to register for weekend activities , without being able to register their friends or remove others from the list to make room for themselves.  We typically have 20 to 25 activity choices on a given weekend. I have been playing around with using the quiz module for this, where we'd create a "quiz" each week that consisted of a single question with the ability to select several answer choices (each event they want to participate in) or a "quiz" where each event has a "yes I want to attend this" or "No thank you" response.  Then the student's name and their "quiz" results would be sent to the Residential Director who could create the list of those actually attending. The things that I think are missing though is a time-stamp so activities can be filled on a first-come-first-served basis with overflow going on a waiting list, or a way to set a limit to the number that can sign up for a particular event.  It would also be wonderful if we could have the Residential Director get a list of who selected which choices, in time order, but that's probably asking a bit much from a quiz module. Thomas Robb suggested that I take a look at the choice module, but the messages I've seen indicate that choices are limited to six options, which rather puts a crimp on how we can do the sign-ups when we run 20 to 25 activities each weekend.  We could seperate out in batches of 6 activities, but I'd rather just have a field of check boxes that the students can click on the activities they want to sign up for. Now, I haven't tried playing around with choice yet to make it fit, but can I get the outputs sorted by choice and time-stamp order?  That is, everyone who selected "Grocery Trip, Fri, 3:15-4:15" in the order that they submitted their request so that we can just fill up the vans and the rest are put on a waiting list when the van capacity is full? Also, is it possible to select more than one choice per question?  Sorry, I know I should probably try playing around with this myself, but I haven't had the time to get to it yet, and if these aren't possible, I'll keep trying to play with the quiz module.
Label:

Post title: Teacher Rating
Post description: Hi! I've just discovered your very cool program and am extremely excited about adding it to my site! However, it looks like my usage will be a bit difference than most of your other examples. I run a website for a large, worldwide historical re-creation group called the Society for Creative Anachronism ("SCA") which researches and recreates the Middle Ages and the Renaissance. I will be using Moodle to allow various people in the SCA to offer classes on subjects they have researched.  As such, I don't have a pre-set, 100% reliable teacher base. Consequently, I'd love to be able to have the students rate the teachers after the class re: skill, knowledge, responsiveness, etc. so that I can weed out the not so good ones. Is there any function for something like this? Or any chance of one in a future version? Regardless, this looks like an awesome program and I'm thrilled to have found it! Thanks!

Forum Post: 
Post title: Add a short response item to Choice activity?
Post description: I am using the Choice activity to have students sign up for in-class presentations over the course of several days. I can use the Choice function to let them sign up for times and limit how many can sign up for a single day so we spread people out. However, I'd like to have an option for them to then answer a short response with the topic of their presentation so I (and the class) can see what topics will be presented each day. Is there any way to add a second question to the Choice activity, or include a "comment" on the choice selected where students could input their topic? Alternatively, are there any question types available in the Feedback or Quiz modules that would accomplish the same function as the Choice? I could build the short answer question into a Feedback activity, but I couldn't find any option for a "signup" type question where the number of responses to each choice is limited. I could, of course, use two different modules for the two different questions, but that is awkward and likely to get poor response from students.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: The Scheduler (cf. https://moodle.org/plugins/mod_scheduler ) plugin might suit your need in this case.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Restrictions based on Choice - again
Post description: Hello everyone! Trying to implement a guided route
on the educational material for my students using restricted access, I
realized that something is missing from Moodle. There is no way to
restrict access based on a choice activity. (*see note below) The restrictions that can be imposed on content are based on the following factors: activity completion date grades group grouping profile I strongly believe that adding the extra factor of "choice" on
the restrictions would help greatly and I believe that it shouldn't be
technically difficult to do so. What do you think? This feature has been mentioned multiple times in earlier discussions: https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=226273 (I agree with Mary and I have used this method, but this is different) https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=221923 https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=335529 Thanks in advance! (*) Note: There is a complicated way to do something similar, but not exactly this. By using the group choice plugin and the restriction
by group, we can partially achieve this, but it requires an extra
plugin and makes the restriction global for the whole course, not just
for the part that is needed. Added to this, in case where groups are
needed for other use, this workaround is not suitable.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Change default permission: Record a Choice
Post description: We use the choice activity for nearly every class session in a college course: Are you going to be in-person or virtual for this session? The default permission for this includes teachers as well as students. When the teacher then goes to view the results of the activity, all enrollees are shown (including teachers). Removing the role of the teacher from Record a choice on permissions fixes this. However, this must be done for each choice activity. The permission DOES NOT copy over when the activity is duplicated, making this process extremely tedious. Is there a way to change the default setting for this? Another workaround?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: You should be able to do this at the site level via Site Admin - Users - Permissions - Define Roles. Edit the teacher role and change the "mod/choice:choose" permission to "Not Set" so it applies to all activities .

Post title: Change colour of student bar chart
Post description: Is it possible to change the colour of the bar chart that the students see in the choice activity? The default purple does not go with my site's theme
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: There is a $CFG setting, unfortunately i could not find it in the web administration or in the settings of the plugin. So I put this in my config.php in the moodle root src directory: 
```text
$CFG->chart_colorset = array('#0067a5');
```
 
```text
and restartet the webserver (nginx or apache) => it worked.
```
 
```text
In this case it is dark blue ('#0067a5').
```

Forum Post: 
Post title: Does choice have an automatic notification email - is not, can I set one up?
Post description: I would like to have an automatic notification email that is sent to the teacher and student when a choice has been made. I was wondering whether this is possible in any way.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: You could look at the event monitoring subscription for this. Also See https://docs.moodle.org/33/en/Event_monitoring There is an event called "Choice answer added" in the events list /report/eventlist/index.php You would initially need to create an event monitoring rule for this event. Then anyone subscribed to that event can get a notification every time a choice has been made. Teachers, non-editing teachers and managers by default will be able to access event monitoring in their Preferences page. For students to be able to subscribe, you would first need to override their permissions for "Subscribe to event monitor rules tool/monitor:subscribe" in that particular course. The user then needs to subscribe to the event themselves to receive emails. They can select to get notifications for a specific choice only, or for all choice activities on the course.

Post title: Completion tracking on specific choice selected
Post description: In MDL-27680 ( https://tracker.moodle.org/browse/MDL-27680 ) was discussed "it might make sense to allow completion tracking to check which option is selected." This would enable choice module to be used as a "gatekeeper" where a user could not progress until they had selected the "continue" option. Currently, completion tracking does not distinguish between choices made. Such a change outlined above would also potentially require ability for a user to change their selection from "stop" to "continue" option. Dan, do you think such a change is practical in the wider Choice module, or should we look at a local customisation? Can you estimate the amount of work required to make such changes? Others here, do you have an alternative method (preferably that's not using the quiz module, since it's rather a clunky solution to the problem) for acting as a "gatekeeper" on a user's progress in the course?

Comment 3: I testet it with one single test-user (role as student) in a test-course. The size-limit was 5. But another limit will cause the error too.
Comment 4: It seems that there is a problem with our MSSQL -CLuster and the lock-API. We have another moodle-instance with a maria-DB and the same code-base and the choice-plugin works fine there.
Comment 5: Solved: config.php: $CFG->lock_factory = "auto"; Moodle switches to file_lock_factory
here, because MS SQL doesn´t support DB-Locking (?). The apache couldn´t
write in the file-systeme because of missing write-permissions. After we corrected the apache write-permissions the choice-plugin works fine again. Regards, Robin

Forum Post: 
Post title: Choice participation in gradebook?
Post description: Is there any way to get Moodle (2.x) to give a participation point for taking part in a Choice? I'd like to use it for in-class comprehension checks, because it's fast, people can change their answers, and it doesn't score the answers. I just want to give credit for answering; we'll go over the right answer in class...
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Aaron, I concur.  It would be great if both Choice and feedback could be seen in the gradebook.  Hopefully somebody may respond.......
Comment 2: Sorry for the multiple response above...... While it is not the same as having the choice or feedback activities going directly into the gradebook, i may have a long walk around, particularly if you want to just have a record of the activity completed in a collective place along with other graded activities. Here is the string: Settings>>grade administration>>categories and items>>full view From here you can manually add a grade item, and by creating a scale/grade or text, you can manually input the results of the choice. Like i said, it is a long walk about, but a solution i have just come up with to solve this problem hope it helps
Comment 3: not sure if assigning a grade for choice quite works - but activity completion might provide some of what you're looking for?
Comment 4: Hi Dan, I am trying to use activity completions. Is there any way of adding a restriction to the choice for the next activity ? I am trying to set up a Student agreement (online contract compulsory to sign), so i was hoping that i could use the selection "I agree" to unlock the next activity. Any information would be fantastic!!
Comment 5: You could make the choice with just one choice - "I agree" and then once they have made that selection the rest of the course is opened up to them. It is currently not possible to restrict activities based on a particular choice selection but if you offer them only one, it should work. So if they don't agree, they don't click " I agree" and they don't get to do the rest of the course.
Comment 6: Is this agreement applicable to a specific Moodle course only or to using the entire Moodle on your site? If it is the latter, you could use the site policy functionality, which does exactly what you want except that applies to using the entire Moodle (it pops up during login and does not let users continue if they do not agree).

Post title: Hide Choice Activity for those roles who has not assign by admin
Post description: Hi, I am working on a site survey sites. I have implement a Movie Survey by using Choice. I want to provide access of this activity only those roles which I want. I have successfully got how to do this. But that Activity showing on homepage for both anonymous as well those users roles which I have not assign. Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Please help me guys.
Comment 2: Rather than roles, put the users you want to access the survey into a group and make the Choice activity available only to that group
Comment 3: Hi Nishant, I have had the same issue, which is why I created tracker MDL-49029 -- please vote on this. Normally, role restricting could be done at the activity-level in the permissions. The Choice module, however, does not have a specific "view" permission, therefore, one cannot turn it on/off per role (other than hiding it or grouping it).  I haven't tried this yet, but it is possible to make groups on the front page , then as suggested, you could group the choice module. I agree, despite the fact that guests don't have access to making the choice, I only want authenticated users to see this activity at all.

Post title: A group member vote for the whole group
Post description: In our classroom we work with groups and groupings. We are now faced with the following problem. A number of groups are involved in the classroom and each group has to choose one appointment from a list of 5. We would like to use the choice module. The choice of appointment for each group should be made by one of the group's members; in a similar fashion to the "Students submit in groups" option of the Assignment module Any ideas how we can solve this Problem We use moodle 2.4.1
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: "Students submit in groups" is a solution that the Assignment people figured out. However, there is no general concept of teams in Moodle, so there is approach that is imposed on all modules. By team I mean a group which Moodle can treat as a single person where needed, and if I understand correctly, this is what you are after. You may try to come up with a workable solution using the database module.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Students Are Selecting Choices beyond the limit
Post description: Good day to you. I am seeking some assistance. My institution recently upgraded to Moodle 2.4. We are noticing however that when choice activities have been created, even if an instructor limits a particular option to accommodate 5 responses, more than 5 individuals are able to select that option. This causes confusion for the department staff as well as the students. Is anyone else experiencing this same issue and if so what recommendations could you kindly suggest to resolve this issue? Regards, Kirk Wilson
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: The most common cause of this is described in MDL-12083 - it relates to users being un-enrolled in a course removing the selected option allowing others to take their place but then re-enrolling in the course and having their choice restored. there are a couple of other bugs in the tracker that might be related as well.
Comment 2: Hi Dan. Thanks much for your quick feedback. I really appreciate it. My issue seems to be slightly different as we have observed it in courses where students were not unenrolled. Up to last week I created a new choice activity in a test course and had fellow staff members enrol themselves in the course and participate in the choice. No one was removed either by themselves or by me. Yet, it was still observed that persons were able to over-register for particular sessions. So right now I have five (5) persons registered for an option that was limited to take three (3) responses alone. Any further assistance would be welcome. Regards, Kirk Wilson
Comment 3: Hi Maybe you should check group(s) settings. Is it the activity group based? Regards
Comment 4: We're getting reports from lecturers of the exact same problem (also on 2.4), and again unenrolments are not involved. One lecturer found that 7 people had been able to choose an option that was limited to two.
Comment 5: Hi Bart, Are you using groups for that course or activity? Thanks
Comment 6: Hi Bart, were you able to get this sorted? Did it have anything to do with groups? I have a similar issue reported with a course on our 2.4 system. I'm trying to reproduce the issue with no luck so far. Any help would be appreciated. You can email me direct if that works better. steve_gormley@carleton.ca

Forum Post: 
Post title: Answer a Choice without logging in?
Post description: Hello,  (2.4+) I like a way for my staff to let me know why they can't sign up for a session course without having to log in. (Overbooked? Inconvenient location? Inconvenient time?) Is there a way to do this? I thought Choice would work, but even after changing the Permissions for both the Activity and the Course to include Guests and being able to make a choice-- I still get an error message that I must be enrolled to make a choice. I tried Feedback with the same result. I put it on the first page and got the message that I needed to be logged in. Liz
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: I must be missing your point somehow. How does Moodle know who is answering the choice when user is not logged in? If everybody answers choice as a guest, you would have a single answer regardless how many people answered. If you really need anonymous answers from multiple users, use the feedback module.
Comment 2: I tried this with the feedback module first! Even though there is guest access to the course, and the feedback was set to be anonymous, guests don't have the opportunity to answer a question. I added a sample feedback question here: http://wstraining.org/moodle/course/view.php?id=5
Comment 3: Choice won't work for non-logged in users; Feedback WILL work but only if you put it on the front page of your Moodle and not in a course -see number 1 here http://docs.moodle.org/en/Feedback_FAQ
Comment 4: Thank you. Is there any way to do what I propose? Since the reason I'm asking why the person can't take the session is because they can't take the session, I'd like them not to have to enroll in the class in order to tell me why.
Comment 5: Well a simple workaround would be to make a form in Google forms and then link to it from your guest access course.
Comment 6: Thank you. I'll look for a non-Moodle solution.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Displaying Vote Results to Entire Class
Post description: I would like to use the CHOICE activity, but have a question: After the voting is complete, as the teacher I would like to show the "results" screen to my class and generate some class discussion.  The problem is that, if I log into my Moodle page as the teacher, then the individual student names will be shown when I display the results.  No good there. If I change roles to view the page as a "student", so that the voting displays anonymously, my CHOICE activity requires me to vote as the "student" before seeing the results...thereby skewing the actual voting by 1 vote! So....my question is: How, as the teacher, can I display the final voting results to my class for discussion....without also displaying the names of each student publicly? PS - I realize I could log in as one of the students in my classroom....but is there any other way?  Surely there must be! Thanks!
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Dear Mr Murray, After a little experimentation, I found that in my case (Moodle 2.3), I can do this in two ways: (1) Under Publish Results, I choose "Always show results to students" (2) I restrict answering to a certain time period and, under publish results, I choose "Show results to students only after the choice is closed". In both cases, when I look at the Choice activity as a teacher, I can see a bar graph with the response count but without the names. The names appear only if I click on "View responses". These workarounds are not perfect if one uses Moodle as an alternative to clickers in that with (1) students may be influenced by the choices of classmates who vote before them (visible on their mobile devices) and with (2) it may be cumbersome to set up the right time to end the activity, especially if multiple activities are used in succession. Ideally, one would want the teacher to be able to see the graph even when the students cannot. If, however, the teacher asks the students to vote before the class and only wants to display the results in class, (2) seems fine. Best regards, Sergio Mazzarelli
Comment 2: These workarounds are not perfect if one uses Moodle as an alternative to clickers.. Have you tried the Realtime Quiz plugin ( http://moodle.org/plugins/view.php?plugin=mod_realtimequiz )? It basically replicates the features of a clicker in Moodle.  It will allow students to see the results of voting on questions that you set up in advance.

Comments associated with the post:

Comment 2: Virginia - I notice from other posts that you are on 1.9. It might be worth checking with your admin that students haven't been assigned the role sitewide via Site admin >Assign system roles -this would put them in your course as well as everywhere else. Forum Post: 
Post title: Choice module update issue
Post description: Hi, we encountered the following issue when updating a moodle 1.9.12 via moodle 2.2.4 to a recent moodle 2.3.1. and then backingup/restoring to a different native moodle 2.3.1 (same code): In moodle 1.9.12: choices are filled out, responses are displayed correctly. In updated moodle 2.3.1: choices are there, responses are displayed correctly. After backup/restore to a fresh moodle 2.3.1 installation: choices are there, but no responses are included. New responses can be made, and the new ones are displayed correctly. Any idea, why I lost responses during backup/restore in the same moodle version? In addition to that, the order of choice options is mixed up after backup/restore. Best regards, Marcus
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: heh - that's a bug that was introduced in Moodle 2.0 but hasn't been noticed until the past couple of weeks - if you update to the latest stable it should work a bit better - see MDL-34994 for more info.
Comment 2: Hi Dan, thanks for concentrating my attention on the respective bug tracker entry, and of course thanks for fixing the issue! We implemented the suggested code into our 2.3.1, and found that restored user data is displayed now. Do you also have an idea concerning the order of choices? The issue with that is that people often don´t really read the text, and if voting options are not in the ascending or descending order, they click on the wrong item. Best regards, Marcus
Comment 3: heh - wasn't paying much attention there... that's an easy fix too - had to make a similar change in SCORM code already, if you create a new tracker issue for it I'll push through a fix sometime this week.
Comment 4: Thanks Dan, here we go: http://tracker.moodle.org/browse/MDL-35208 Best Regards, Marcus

Forum Post: 
Post title: i get "Course module is incorrect" error when i try to set up choice on mooodle 1.9.3 main page
Post description: Hi all! please help me with my problem - i want to use choice block on moodle's MAIN page. So i set up choice element on my main page, but can't then access it - there is "Course module is incorrect" error... So i can't set up block because it gets information from this choice element... Will be very appreciate for any advice, Alexander
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: it's ok now after moodle reinstall.. so i could not find out what the problem was about. My next problem is to set Choice block on Moodle's main page (for all courses). Is it possible? (i still can't make it work with Choice and Choice_Quick blocks..) Thanks ahaid! Alexander
Comment 2: For anyone trying to find a solution here we tracked our problem to the logs table. Although it is set to keep logs for 2 days the logs table was 100mb, with 750,000 records. This was stopping the backup/export from working, although it never reported a problem. After physically emptying the log table and doing the backup again the import worked and the page works. It appears that the logs prevented the user table from importing which in turn stopped the articles as the user that created them did not exist. I hope our experience helps someone.
Comment 3: I managed to copy the wrong code into the instructions. An updated version is attached.

Post title: Date and time on export files
Post description: All I am using 2.1.4. Is there a way to show the date and time a choice answer was submitted in the export files?  Right now if I download as an Excel it shows the persons name and their choice but not when they submitted it. Scott Karren
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Yes u can do it by editing moodle source code. In mod\choice\report.php, below line no:136, add the following line $myxls->write_string(0,5,get_string("choicedate","choice")); And below line no:169, add the following lines $choicedate = date("M-d-Y",mktime($user->timemodified)); $myxls->write_string($row,5,$choicedate); Regards, Brahmaiah Petluri , Moodle Development Team, Human Logic

Post title: Quiz with problem area associations
Post description: I am trying to create an ESL grammar assessment test using multiple choice. I want to automate this completely, so I want to associate each question and option with an area of grammar so that when the students' responses are tabulated in the database , that I can then generate reports from. For an individual student I would like a report that shows the grammar areas that were passed and those that were failed. For a whole class I  would like to see the general trends with percentage breakdowns. Once I have this in place, a future development would be to then link the failed areas from the assessment to a customized set of online lessons and activities to address an individual student's weak areas. So is this level of customization easily do-able in Moodle? I'm  trying to decide now whether to try to use Moodle to make this, or to build it myself from scratch. Thanks for any advice...!
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: I think this is in the wrong forum as you can't really do this with the Choice module. You can get an automated Quiz (using the Quiz module) of multiple choice questions and get a report out of it later that shows you who answered which question correctly, which questions were mostly answered best and worst overall etc. Not sure about the future development part, where it would then automatically create a set of customised lessons.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Choice module: Feature proposal  add multiple choices.
Post description: Hello

I have seen that this topic has been asked at least a year ago and the standard answer
was that the feedback and questionnaire module would provide this functionality at least roughly.

I have tested feedback so far and it does not provide what I would need, since it does not publish the results of each student right away:

Rationale:

Periodically I submit a set of exercise to my students which they have to solve, and they can pick up the exercise they want to work with.

In order to avoid that some students pick up the same exercise I set up a choice activity:
Each question has limit 1, the results of the choice is published immediately with full names.
This way the student knows which exercise is already taken.

However when I do this, a student *cannot* pick up more than one exercise.
Frankly I think this restriction should be configurable in the sense that it should be allowed for a student to chose more than just one exercise.

In the feedback module there is no publication function, so the student cannot know which exercise is already taken.

what I have done so far is to have a choice activity for each exercise of a certain topic a procedure which is rather cumbersome.

That is why I would like to ask the authors of that module to add this option.

thank you

Uwe Brauer
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi! this wouldn't be a hard feature to implement - if you find a developer to do this I'd be happy to review the patch for inclusion in core or if you have some funding to implement the feature let me know.

Post title: More choice-items than people selecting
Post description: This is the case. 15 items in the choice-list, but only 10 people selecting. We want all the items to be selected. So 5 people can chose an extra item. Is that possible? Thank you, Hidde
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: the choice module doesn't allow multiple selection at this stage.

Post title: Choice number preference vote
Post description: Hi all, I was wondering if the following was possible; Setting up a choice for school sport selections, each choice has a restriced number of positions and becomes unavailable once filled. however I was also after a number preference type choice eg restrict to only 3 possible choices out of a large total and select 1 as most preffered and 3 being 3rd choice, once 3 choices are used no more can be made. I hope this makes sence, kind of live voting, preferences 1-3 out of a large number. Cheeers Andrew
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Andrew, Did you get an answer to this? I have the same question. Simon
Comment 2: Hi Andrew, I'm looking for something very similar myself, though I can confirm that this is not currently possible without installing a third-party tool or applying a patch to core code. I've been asked to find a way to allow students to select up to five from several (135) available projects. Each project can allow only five students to select it. Once all selections have been made the teacher will export the selections and use an algorithm someone else has provided to allocate one project to each student from their choices. So far I've worked out that I can restrict the number of students choosing a project using a Choice activity, but not allow more than one selection per choice. The Questionnaire/Feedback tool has the opposite problem; students can select up to 5 but the number of project selections can't be limited. Does anyone know of a way to do this? I'm open to third-party tools but would prefer to avoid patches to core code. Any help would be much appreciated.
Comment 3: There used to be a module for signing up for exams, which would do pretty much what you need. It allowed a group of students to choose an exam date from several available (projects in your case) with each date having a set limit for the number of students. It even had a waiting queue feature, if I recall. It ensured that a student selected only a single date. So, in your case, you could have set up 5 identical instances for students to select their projects. I don't think that module is supported anymore but I haven't looked at it for quite a while. It could be a good base to make your own custom module if needed.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Front Page of Moodle.org
Post description: OK...I think I'm in tutorial overload!!! Would someone kindly give me the flow tree to where I set the top menu (like "About/News/Support" and such)? Also, how I set (place and link) big icons like are on the home page of moodle.org. I'm a Joomla! user so I'm looking for the short version! Joomla! has a menus section for creating them. Everything seems to be written for the Moodle course level. My guess is that I'll make the artwork, place it on a certain page and link it somehow!!!
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: What version of Moodle are you using? 1.9 or 2.0? With either, if you set the front page settings to "include a topic section" then when you turn on th editing on the front page you get a block you can edit where you can insert images and then you can hyperlink those images to courses/categories as you wish. Moodle.org has its own custom theme but if you have Moodle 2.0 then you can have tabs at the top by going to site admin>appearance>themes>theme settings and scroll down you get "custom menu items" where you can make your own menus.
Comment 2: Having your own custom theme would explain...why I can't find it!!! I'm new at Moodle so I went with the new 2.0 as there is no reason to learn the old and then upgrade. I know this way may have less info but at least I'll be on the front side as it developments!!! I've found them and it's time to start playing! Moodle is SOOO close in many ways to Joomla! but at the same time SOOO different!!! I actually make my own templates for Joomla! so I know where everything is and where stuff goes! Glad to see you hanging out. Ain't it O'dark thirty where you are???
Comment 3: Hi Dan, As Mary has said, the large icon type images are simply that, images in the topic section of a page with hyperlinks. Having seen it here first, I used it for my original primary school website as the children (and some of the staff!) prefered it to navigating menus. The custom menu option for Moodle 2 is a really useful tool to create menus without needing to go into the theme files themselves as you needed to do in Moodle1.9. It can be difficult to style, but if you find a theme you like as a starting point and explore how the menu is styled there, and then look at a few others, you can eventually find your way around it. The other thing with the Moodle2 custom menu is once you do get some experience playing round with the Moodle Themes , you can look at overriding the renderer to do all sorts of things with it. Maybe one step at a time, but keep on going - the moodle learning curve gets you there and with the support of the 2 Marys and others on these forums, everything is achievable!!! Rich

Post title: Choice in Moodle 2.0 opens in new window
Post description: Apologies if I missed something obvious or any previous post on this, but I couldn't find anything. In Moodle 2.0 e.g. Moodle 2.0.2+ (20110223) when a student makes a Choice (choice activity) the next screen opens in a new window which can lead to problems and confusion. Forum Post: 
Post title: Choice: Moodle 1.9 - managing student progression
Post description: How can we force a student to complete a choice before progressing in the course? Before a student commences study they must sign acknowldegement and acceptance for Induction and assessment. How can we manage this successfully?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: You can do this with the choice module if you add support for conditional acitivities in your Moodle installation. This is, however, not so trivial and must be done by technically-oriented people. There is a separate forum on moodle.org devoted to that. Moodle also has a feature called "Site policy" which might do exactly what you want. In site settings, the admin must enter the address of the site policy (acknowldegement and acceptance for Induction and assessment in your case). From then on, Moodle won't let users in unless they accept it.
Comment 2: Thanks - i will try the site policy first and see how we fair.

Forum Post: 
Post title: voting suggestions
Post description: I would like to set up a voting "system" within Moodle and wonder if anyone has suggestions for implementing this. My ideal would be something that supports a "single transferrable vote"...
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: I set up an election between candidates running for offices with 3 separate choices. Voters were only allowed to select one for each office (Pres./VP, Secretary and Treasurer). I had a new class created called "Freshman Elections," and the students had to register for the course with a key given them by their social studies teachers. A day before the election I changed the key to lockout further changes. We learned that although 300+ users can login to Moodle at the same time, they could not all write to the database at the same time. We left the election open over night. Let me know if you have further questions.
Comment 2: Michael,  This is exactly what we would like to do for our Student Union Elections but I do not undertsand your solution fully.  Please can you elaborate. Do you mean that I should create an 'election' course and then use the choice activity to enable students to vote?  I haven't used choice before so I shall go and read up on this right now. Our main concern is to allow easy access but limit students to just one vote per position. Regards lesley
Comment 3: Hi Lesley. Yes, that's what I'd do - in fact what we have done - when having 'elections' Choice lends itself very well to this sort of thing and you can set it so they can only vote once and they can only vote for one person. You can set a time limit for voting too - ie , 24 hour period for example.
Comment 4: Do you know is there a way to do voting when you want more than one choice.  Another words they can vote for 4 people.

Forum Post: 
Post title: guests using choice module
Post description: I created a course for a teacher, with guest access. The kids are supposed to choose their favorite book. I thought I had things set, but when the teacher tried to vote it said guests couldn't make choices. I found where in the admin area to grant guests permission to make choices. But now it doesn't seem to record the choice. I make a choice as a guest, log in as admin, and it says nobody has made a choice. What am I doing wrong?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: solved. I just created a generic account called "student" and it seems to work now. Only problem is, that this user can only vote once. When I vote again, it just changes the users vote, but doesn't add to the tally. Anyone know how to make it so a user can vote more than once?
Comment 2: To collect multiple votes, you need multiple voting activities . Normally, each user has a single vote (choice), so voting again is expected to change the previous vote. You can rig multiple-choice solution using the database module me thinks.
Comment 3: What do you mean by "multiple voting activities"?
Comment 4: Hi Will, For each user's choice to be recorded individually they have to be each logged in with their own account. If you think about it, it can't be any other way. Moodle has no way of distinguishing between users if they all use the same "generic" account. Cheers, Glenys
Comment 5: Try Feedback: Anonymous choices and multiple entries SHOULD allow users (and a shared ID) to enter more than once, and record each occasion. However, the fly in the ointment is that the user that re-enters (or the second person using the shared ID) sees a message saying 'you have already completed this feedback' - but IS then allowed to make another entry.
Comment 6: If you want to get two separate votes, you need to set up two separate choice instances. If you want to allow making more than one choice within a single instance of activity, try the database module, as I said earlier. It has an option to allow multiple records per participant. Using a common userid for multiple people will still be problematic.

Post title: how to integrate choice into forum, seeing voters' feedback and comments
Post description: I would love to have a choice into my forum so I can see everybody's answers and also their opinions,comments to the choice question. and kind of debate, to hear respondents' thoughtful thinkings and ideas..how can I do that? or can I ?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Kimberly, You could use the Q&A forum to ask your question giving them the choice of answers you want them to use in their forum post and ask them to give comments. They will not see the other participants answers until they post and after they have posted they can reply to the other posts and start debating. You could also run a Choice activity to tally up the results, if the settings allow the student to allow the choice to be updated then you can also see if the debating in the forum changed anyone's mind. Is this the kind of activity you were looking for?
Comment 2: Hi, not sure about displaying results, but you can simply copy the url from an existing choice (click on the link & copy properties) to access the choice directly from the forum. Best Paul
Comment 3: Thank you both! I will try and update my results later

Comment 4: Dunno - I wasn't sure whether the groups issue was it. If it is it messes up a lot of stuff I wanted to do. I'll watch this space with interest. Paul

Forum Post: 
Post title: How does Choice support single transferable vote?
Post description: Greetings!

I have come across a discussion or two in relation to the support of Choice for single transferable vote, but I have not quite grabbed the essence. Could anyone please explain a bit more in details on how Choice is supporting single transferable vote or alternative transferable vote? Does Moodle automatically distribute the number of votes against the candidates? Or does the polling administrator need to do that manually?

Thank you very much in advance and I look forward to hearing your feedback soon.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi My understanding of the term 'single transferable vote' in the context of the Moodle Choice activity is... A Choice activity allows a Student to make a single choice from a range of options. (This is like voting for something). However, the Teacher can setup a Choice activity so that a Student can change their mind, and change their selection . So the Student can transfer their vote to a different option. Perhaps this is what is meant by 'single transferable vote' ?

Forum Post: 
Post title: Choosing "choice" to constitute groups
Post description: Hello, I have to distribute more than 100 students to 6 groups with limited number of students. The students shall be able to check who is already in which group, to select their group and to change the group (before a deadline) if they want. So the choice module seems ideal. My problem: how can I easily transfer the choise "results" to working groups in the course? Vera
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Vera, I looked at adding this as a feature to the choice here: http://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=24656 be careful with this patch though as I haven't tested it, and the choice module has gone through quite a few changes since! it was decided that the Choice module was the wrong place for this, that it should be included in the groups management. there's a patch somewhere in this fourm that adds it to the group end -
not sure what version, or whether it works still - make sure you test
these patches in a non-production environment as they may break
something. http://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=6247 Also - if you were able to arrange funding for this development, you
could contact moodle.com or one of the Moodle Partners and they may be
able to develop something for you that works!
Comment 2: I would like to get groups made directly from choices. Is this possible. For example, students select labs based on choices, and these choices automatically become lab groupings.
Comment 3: Hi There, please avoid cross-posting - especially in the same forum! the latest version of a group self-selection patch is available via: http://tracker.moodle.org/browse/CONTRIB-1273 it isn't something that will be added to the choice module. thanks,

Forum Post: 
Post title: Grade for completing choice?
Post description: Does anyone have any creative (or more practical) ways to give students a grade for completing a choice? I've created an offline assignment that is not visible to students that I call 'Choice grades' where I manually update grades when they answer the choice. This is difficult to keep track of though. Any other ideas?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi There, you should use a 1 question quiz. The choice is not designed to have a grade assigned.
Comment 2: Margaret - The feedback module will be included in 2.0. I don't believe it currently has any grading functionality built in to it but you could create a feature request in the Moodle Tracker . Also, you could request that the choice have an option for grading based on completion. Practically speaking, Dan's suggestion is a good one to just use a single question quiz. I've seen this done when a teacher is first starting with Moodle and wants to ensure that the students can take a quiz and then give them credit for doing so. Let us know what works best for you. Peace - Anthony

Forum Post: 
Post title: Inserting a choice and make it usable for guests too
Post description: Hello everybody! I'd like to insert a one-question quiz in my Moodle. After some reading I got that what I'm looking for is a Choice Form. I created it, I tried it but I can't see my answer counted on the percentage that appears after answering. Where am I wrong? Thanks for your attention!
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: allowing "guests" to submit responses to a choice is not currently supported. In moodle when someone logs into the site as a "guest" they all use the same user record "guest" - All responses to Choices are linked to a user record, so if you allowed "guests" to submit a choice, you would only ever have 1 entry for the "guest" user.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Help! with student documentation
Post description: Hi, i've only just started to use moodle and i have set up choices for the students to enrol in tutorial groups.  However my main problem is that i need a simple letter for students to understand on how to choose their groups.  Any advice would be greatly appreciated as my students have a habit of not reading things properly. Also i have another query once all my wonderful students have made their choice is their a simple way to create groups from the choice results.  Third and finally can students within a group be contacted without the information being broadcasted to those that are enrolled in the course. Our uni site has some courses running soon about this but they will be too late for the start of the session. Thanks Claire
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Suppose you have 24 students and you want to create six groups with four students each. Create a Choice activity with four choices labeled A, B, C, D, E, and F, each with a limit of 4. Have the students do the activity. If you want them to be able to choose who they work with, select "Always display results to students." When everyone has chosen, you will have to manually set up the groups.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Choice will not work...
Post description: If one of our teachers goes through the process of setting up a choice project and then clicks on the link the message "site not found" appears. The same thing happens if the teacher chooses to "display a directory". Can anyone suggest a solution to the problem?  Any help would be greatly appreciated.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: If it's only happening for that one teacher then that would suggest that there is something up at their end (perhaps with their PC or network profile), rather than there being a problem with your Moodle installation. Does the same problem occur with other users?
Comment 2: This happens for all teachers. They can set up the form for a Choice activity.  However, when they click on the Save changes button the program aborts with a 404 "File Not Found" error. We are running Moodle on a Windows Server 2003 box; MySQL 5; PHP 5; IIS 6 and Moodle 1.5.4+.
Comment 3: Sounds like you could be missing some of the Moodle files, which is strange. That, or your permissions for some files are such that the server can't read them. Personally, I'd back up your current system (do a database dump and copy application files elsewhere) and upgrade to a newer version.

Post title: Choice in moodle 1.7
Post description: Just upgraded to moodle 1.7 this weekend and have noticed something funny/strange with the choice module. Post title: Lots of Choices

Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Peter, The choice module is setup for just one question (multiple choices) per page.  You may want to check out the Feedback module or the Questionnaire module.  They will do what you want.  Neither one are in the standard install, so you might look at the Modules and Plugins area of the main moodle.org site. Comment 1: copy of my reply to your report: bug 5056 it looks like you have copied a version of the choice module into the mod directory. - the instructions posted on the forum could be a little misleading. it mentions to copy the existing files and keep them as a backup - copy to somewhere else outside your moodle install. - then replace the files in your moodle install with the ones posted in the forum. because you now have 2 copies of the choice mod in your install, I would suggest you go to the admin/modules page, and "hide" the one listed "copy of choice" - don't delete it because it might delete data from your original choice mod. then go back to the "copy of choice" directory - you shuold be safe deleting this, as it will not affect your choice data directly. then make sure that you have copied the new files from the forum into the normal mod\choice directory. hope that helps!

Post title: hack for printing choice confirmation
Post description: I am pruning this from the 'philosophical' thread so it is more exposed. RE: I just got a request from management that the exam signups in Moodle must allow students to print a signup confirmation. Well, I have just successfully added this option to Choice. It is a hack and I somehow think it should be a hack since it will probably always need to be customized for local needs. However, adding it is quite simple: an extra field in the database , a few new language strings, an extra php file, and a few extra lines in view.php.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: shouldn't this simply be a print button on the page that shows their selection? - see the screen that shows when a student has selected a choice and they are unable to update it. - why do you need an extra field in the db? Dan
Comment 2: I display both a print icon and textual link. Just so it is clear what will be printed. The link does not actually print but displays a confirmation page which contains course info, student's name and id-number, choice answer, answer date, print date, and confirmation id (unique code to stove off falsification) formatted for printing. Students have to print it themselves. The extra field in db is a flag to control which choice instances display this option. We have probably a dozen choices on the site but only one requires this option (another one still coming).

Forum Post: 
Post title: Copy of Choice modules in the weekly format
Post description: I want to use a Choice Module for a regular weekly feedback in a 9 month course (in weekly format). How can I copy the choice module two every week of my course. Thanks for your help.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: There isn't a quick and easy way of doing this, but if you are semi-familiar with XML, I would be tempted to do this doing a backup of the course, and editing the moodle.xml page. Create a Choice in the 1st week of your course, then do a full backup of your course and save it seperately just in case you break something! then create a backup file with only the data you want - eg don't backup the user data and only include the choice module. - open a new copy of the moodle.xml file created inside the backup zip file. now follow the instructions in the attached file to this post - I couldn't get moodle to display the XML tags properly, so put these in a seperate file! after making the changes given in the attached file., restore the file - I would suggest to a new course first to make sure you didn't break anything! and then if that works restore it to your own course "adding data to it" - (you will end up with 2 choices in the first section, but you can just delete one of them!) Good luck!!

Forum Post: 
Post title: Poll (Choice) Problems
Post description: After doing an unsuccessful search, I'm turning here for help. My poll only shows one answer even though several people have responded. Is there an open bug in the choice module? Thanks for any help. Cheers, ptervin...wanting to count
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: No, there's no known bugs with the current code ...
Comment 2: Thanks for the encouragement but I'm still only getting one answer shown. I've probably set something up incorrectly so I'll continue to look around. There are a couple of other problems that have crept in as well so I may be asking further questions. Server crashes don't seem to help when one is learning a new program! Cheers, ptervin...still countless
Comment 3: It's a bummer - I don't have any ideas on this one, nor have I seen it before. The Choice code is not particularly complex, though, so debugging the problem shouldn't be too hard. There are three tricks I use to solve almost every Moodle problem: 1) Turn on the 'debug' variable in "Configure Variables" - when you try the Choice you might get a new error message that provides a clue. 2) Add this: $db->debug = true; somewhere in the code. This will make all the SQL statements visible on the page. 3) Add lines like: print_object($variable); in the code to get dumps of objects, arrays or plain variables, so you can track what data is going where.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Weekend Activity Registration
Post description: I teach at Linden Hall School, a private girls' boarding school with around 120 students.  We are looking for a better way to allow students to register for weekend activities , without being able to register their friends or remove others from the list to make room for themselves.  We typically have 20 to 25 activity choices on a given weekend. I have been playing around with using the quiz module for this, where we'd create a "quiz" each week that consisted of a single question with the ability to select several answer choices (each event they want to participate in) or a "quiz" where each event has a "yes I want to attend this" or "No thank you" response.  Then the student's name and their "quiz" results would be sent to the Residential Director who could create the list of those actually attending. The things that I think are missing though is a time-stamp so activities can be filled on a first-come-first-served basis with overflow going on a waiting list, or a way to set a limit to the number that can sign up for a particular event.  It would also be wonderful if we could have the Residential Director get a list of who selected which choices, in time order, but that's probably asking a bit much from a quiz module. Thomas Robb suggested that I take a look at the choice module, but the messages I've seen indicate that choices are limited to six options, which rather puts a crimp on how we can do the sign-ups when we run 20 to 25 activities each weekend.  We could seperate out in batches of 6 activities, but I'd rather just have a field of check boxes that the students can click on the activities they want to sign up for. Now, I haven't tried playing around with choice yet to make it fit, but can I get the outputs sorted by choice and time-stamp order?  That is, everyone who selected "Grocery Trip, Fri, 3:15-4:15" in the order that they submitted their request so that we can just fill up the vans and the rest are put on a waiting list when the van capacity is full? Also, is it possible to select more than one choice per question?  Sorry, I know I should probably try playing around with this myself, but I haven't had the time to get to it yet, and if these aren't possible, I'll keep trying to play with the quiz module.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Teacher Rating
Post description: Hi! I've just discovered your very cool program and am extremely excited about adding it to my site! However, it looks like my usage will be a bit difference than most of your other examples. I run a website for a large, worldwide historical re-creation group called the Society for Creative Anachronism ("SCA") which researches and recreates the Middle Ages and the Renaissance. I will be using Moodle to allow various people in the SCA to offer classes on subjects they have researched.  As such, I don't have a pre-set, 100% reliable teacher base. Consequently, I'd love to be able to have the students rate the teachers after the class re: skill, knowledge, responsiveness, etc. so that I can weed out the not so good ones. Is there any function for something like this? Or any chance of one in a future version? Regardless, this looks like an awesome program and I'm thrilled to have found it! Thanks!
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Creating new surveys currently requires a bit of hacking, but eventually there will be a nice GUI for this. In the meantime, the existing 'COLLES' survey should go some way to helping you understand the effectiveness of the class (with graphs etc). You could also use the 'choice' module to conduct polls on specific questions.
Comment 2: Great! I hadn't thought of using those that way, that oughta do it! Thanks again.
